intro: Chiococca erubescens, commonly known as the red chiococca, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, red or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Chiococca erubescens is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests.
